intro: Pseudosabicea segregata, commonly known as the slender pseudosabicea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Pseudosabicea segregata is often found in humid regions of Brazil, Peru, and Ecuador.
